title: Display Sizing
text: Users can take advantage {docorator}’s built-scaling opt instead specify column widths via {gt}. techniques described .

title: Display Sizing
text: {tfrmt} {gt} tables, {docorator} make best attempt fit display allotted area. Specifically, using default setting tbl_scale = TRUE adjust columns fit allotted display. option first size stub column(s) (.e. columns left-hand side containing row group/label information) according tbl_stub_pct option, make remaining columns equal width. {docorator} uses function scale_gt() apply table sizing hood. need call function directly pdf creation used illustrate examples . Let’s say table 1 stub column 4 columns, like : set tbl_stub_pct=0.4, stub column occupy 40% full width, 4 data columns occupy 15% full width, totaling 100% width. table 2 stub columns, like one , settings tbl_stub_pct=0.4 result 20% width stub column, resulting 40% total stubs.
code: library(gt) mytbl <- gtcars |>    dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) |>    dplyr::select(mfr, model, year, msrp, ctry_origin) |>    gt(rowname_col = "mfr") |>    tab_style(      style = cell_borders(c("left","right")),      locations = list(cells_body(), cells_stub(), cells_column_labels())    )  mytbl mytbl |>   scale_gt(tbl_stub_pct = 0.4) mytbl <- gtcars |>    dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) |>    dplyr::select(mfr, model, year, msrp, ctry_origin) |>    gt(       groupname_col = "ctry_origin",        rowname_col = "mfr",       row_group_as_column = TRUE) |>    tab_style(      style = cell_borders(c("left","right")),      locations = list(cells_body(), cells_stub(), cells_column_labels())    )  mytbl mytbl |>   scale_gt(tbl_stub_pct = 0.4)

title: Display Sizing
text: full control column widths, recommended use gt::cols_width() table prior {docorator}. default, {docorator}’s dynamic scaling override widths, important set tbl_scale = FALSE. Note: widths specified % (.e using either “5%” pct(5)) accepted. widths specified px warning issued dynamic scaling apply. Widths also total 100%. subset columns covered cols_width(), {docorator} expand remaining columns fit allotted width display area. Alternatively, columns covered cols_width(), {docorator} apply resizing fit allotted area.
code: mytbl |>    gt::cols_width(     msrp ~ pct(50)   ) |>    as_docorator(tbl_scale = FALSE) mytbl |>    gt::cols_width(     ctry_origin ~ pct(15),     mfr ~ pct(10),     model ~ pct(7),     year ~ pct(9),     msrp ~ pct(15)   ) |>    as_docorator(tbl_scale = FALSE)

title: Display Sizing
text: Figure sizes can adjusted via fig_dim argument as_docorator(). argument expects numeric vector length 2, first second elements height width inches, respectively. example, default c(5,8) translates height 5 inches width 8 inches.

title: Display Sizing
text: customization options offered future releases. need customize something currently offered, please file issue.

title: Document Sizing
text: default geometry package geom_set(), includes following settings: Users can optionally override defaults passing new values : values set NULL, {docorator} perform automatic size calculations. can overridden hardcoded size values.
code: geom_set() #> $paperheight #> [1] "8.5in" #>  #> $paperwidth #> [1] "11in" #>  #> $left #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $right #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $top #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $bottom #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $headsep #> [1] "10pt" #>  #> $includehead #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $includefoot #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $headheight #> NULL #>  #> $footskip #> NULL geom_set(top = "0.5in", bottom = "0.5in") #> $paperheight #> [1] "8.5in" #>  #> $paperwidth #> [1] "11in" #>  #> $left #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $right #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $headsep #> [1] "10pt" #>  #> $includehead #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $includefoot #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $headheight #> NULL #>  #> $footskip #> NULL #>  #> $top #> [1] "0.5in" #>  #> $bottom #> [1] "0.5in" geom_set(headheight = "20pt") #> $paperheight #> [1] "8.5in" #>  #> $paperwidth #> [1] "11in" #>  #> $left #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $right #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $top #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $bottom #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $headsep #> [1] "10pt" #>  #> $includehead #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $includefoot #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $footskip #> NULL #>  #> $headheight #> [1] "20pt"

title: Document Sizing
text: Advanced users can pass additional geometry settings/values covered defaults. additional settings appended default list. Reference geometry documentation information: https://texdoc.org/serve/geometry.pdf/0.

title: Headers and Footers
text: header argument accepts fancyhead object. fancyhead object accepts series fancyrow objects. correspond line text header. Within fancyrow, can optionally specify left, center, right text (NA indicates blank position). examples .

title: Headers and Footers
code: fancyhead(   fancyrow(left = "My Study", center = NA, right = NA) )

title: Headers and Footers
code: fancyhead(   fancyrow(left = "My Study", center = NA, right = "Date as of today"),   fancyrow(left = "My Population", center = NA, right = NA),   fancyrow(left = NA, center = "My Table", right = NA) )

title: Headers and Footers
text: footer argument as_docorator() accepts fancyfoot object. behaves identically fancyhead accepting series fancyrow objects line footer.

title: Headers and Footers
code: fancyfoot(   fancyrow(left = "Date as of today", center = NA, right = NA) )

title: Headers and Footers
code: fancyfoot(   fancyrow(left = "General footer for the table", center = NA, right = NA),   fancyrow(left = "Date as of today", center = NA, right = "path/to/docname.pdf") )

what: Available utilities for standard or automated information
title: Headers and Footers
text: several functions available features like page numbering time stamps. prefixed doc_*().

previous_headings: Available utilities for standard or automated information
what: Add automatic page numbering in upper left
title: Headers and Footers
code: fancyhead(   fancyrow(left = "My study", center = NA, right = doc_pagenum()) )

previous_headings: Available utilities for standard or automated information
what: Add file path in bottom left and datetime in bottom right
title: Headers and Footers
code: fancyfoot(   fancyrow(left = doc_path(), center = NA, right = doc_datetime()) )

title: Headers and Footers
code: gt::gtcars |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) |>   dplyr::select(mfr, model, year, msrp) |>   gt::gt(     groupname_col = "mfr",     row_group_as_column = TRUE   ) |>    as_docorator(      display_name = "mytbl",     header = fancyhead(       fancyrow(left = "My Study", center = NA, right = doc_pagenum()),       fancyrow(left = "My Population", center = NA, right = NA),       fancyrow(left = NA, center = "My Table", right = NA)     ),     footer = fancyfoot(       fancyrow(         left = "path/mytbl.pdf", center = NA, right = "Data as of 2025-01-01"       )     )    ) |>    render_pdf()

title: Headers and Footers
text: {docorator} automatically adjust allowed height headers footers according lines text required. many lines headers /footers specified, cuts available height table/figure. Additionally, {docorator} auto-wrap long lines text, recommended keep left, right, center text brief possible. Please file issue discover unexpected results problems related headers footers.

title: Render
text: understand underlying LaTeX involved going display object PDF, render_pdf arguments use. transform argument allows pass function manipulate LaTeX string object goes PDF. header_latex argument allows additional LaTeX added header-includes section template.Rmd used PDF generation. example, can pass additional LaTeX libraries . passed .tex file. escape_latex argument controls escaping special characters headers footers. can set FALSE disable escaping manual escaping preferred, .e. results expected.
code: as_docorator(   mytbl,   display_name = "mytbl" ) |>  render_pdf()

title: Render
text: Due limitations RTF file format, arguments specified as_docorator() call preserved, certain formatting table styling. Document decoration headers also preserved, titles specified ‘center’ applied.
code: as_docorator(   mytbl,   display_name = "mytbl" ) |>  render_rtf()

title: Render
text: render_pdf() render_rtf() return original object created as_docorator(), , can piped one another shown example .
code: as_docorator(   mytbl,   display_name = "mytbl" ) |> render_pdf() |> render_rtf()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Becca Krouse. Author, maintainer. Shannon Haughton. Author. Seongbin Hong. Author. Dragoș Moldovan-Grünfeld. Author. GlaxoSmithKline Research & Development Limited. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Krouse B, Haughton S, Hong S, Moldovan-Grünfeld D (2025). docorator: Docorate (Decorate + Output) Displays. R package version 0.5.0.9000, https://GSK-Biostatistics.github.io/docorator/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {docorator: Docorate (Decorate + Output) Displays},   author = {Becca Krouse and Shannon Haughton and Seongbin Hong and Dragoș Moldovan-Grünfeld},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.5.0.9000},   url = {https://GSK-Biostatistics.github.io/docorator/}, }

title: Docorate (Decorate + Output) Displays
text: {docorator} engine creating production displays R. Specifically, {docorator} provides following functionality: Decorate: Surround displays document-level headers, footers, page numbers Output: Export decorated displays file PDF RTF main function, as_docorator() accepts R object containing display input. best results sizing, table prepared via {gt}, packages interface {gt} {tfrmt}, figure prepared {ggplot2}. Alternatively, path PNG can passed {docorator}. Specifically, x one following: gt table gt_group (list gt tables) ggplot2 figure list ggplot figures path PNG file (.e. previously created figure) list paths PNG files docorator object, saved default, can output using one following render functions can piped together: render_pdf() render_rtf()

title: Docorate (Decorate + Output) Displays
code: # install from GitHub devtools::install_github("GSK-Biostatistics/docorator")  # Load package library(docorator)   # Create table (or figure) mytbl <- gt::exibble |>    gt::gt()  # Export display    mytbl |>    as_docorator(      display_name = "mytbl",     header = fancyhead(       fancyrow(left = "My Study", center = NA, right = doc_pagenum()),       fancyrow(left = "My Population", center = NA, right = NA),       fancyrow(left = NA, center = "My Table", right = NA)     ),     footer = fancyfoot(       fancyrow(left = "mypath/mytbl.R", center = NA, right = "Data as of 2025-01-01")     )    ) |>    render_pdf() |>   render_rtf()

title: Docorate (Decorate + Output) Displays
text: {docorator} requires LaTeX libraries PDF rendering. using {tinytex}, “TinyTeX” bundle covers core dependencies.

what: Apply scaling to gt objects — apply_scale
title: Apply scaling to gt objects — apply_scale
text: Apply scaling gt objects

title: Apply scaling to gt objects — apply_scale
code: apply_scale(x, fontsize, tbl_scale, tbl_stub_pct)  # Default S3 method apply_scale(x, fontsize, tbl_scale, tbl_stub_pct)  # S3 method for class 'gt_tbl' apply_scale(x, fontsize, tbl_scale, tbl_stub_pct)  # S3 method for class 'gt_group' apply_scale(x, fontsize, tbl_scale, tbl_stub_pct)

title: Apply scaling to gt objects — apply_scale
text: x gt object fontsize document font size tbl_scale Boolean whether automatically scale table columns fit display area. Defaults TRUE. Note overwrite scaling set table directly unless set FALSE. tbl_stub_pct percent total width dedicated stub column(s). 1 stub column total .

title: Apply scaling to gt objects — apply_scale
text: scaled gt object

title: Apply scaling to gt objects — apply_scale
code: gt <- gt::exibble |> gt::gt()  apply_scale(gt, fontsize = 10, tbl_scale = FALSE, tbl_stub_pct = "20%")     num       char       fctr       date       time       datetime       currency       row       group     1.111e-01 apricot one 2015-01-15 13:35 2018-01-01 02:22 49.950 row_1 grp_a2.222e+00 banana two 2015-02-15 14:40 2018-02-02 14:33 17.950 row_2 grp_a3.333e+01 coconut three 2015-03-15 15:45 2018-03-03 03:44 1.390 row_3 grp_a4.444e+02 durian four 2015-04-15 16:50 2018-04-04 15:55 65100.000 row_4 grp_a5.550e+03 NA five 2015-05-15 17:55 2018-05-05 04:00 1325.810 row_5 grp_bNA fig six 2015-06-15 NA 2018-06-06 16:11 13.255 row_6 grp_b7.770e+05 grapefruit seven NA 19:10 2018-07-07 05:22 NA row_7 grp_b8.880e+06 honeydew eight 2015-08-15 20:20 NA 0.440 row_8 grp_b

title: Create docorator object — as_docorator
text: Create docorator object

title: Create docorator object — as_docorator
code: as_docorator(   x,   display_name,   display_loc = NULL,   header = fancyhead(fancyrow(right = doc_pagenum())),   footer = fancyfoot(fancyrow(left = doc_path(display_name, display_loc), right =     doc_datetime())),   save_object = TRUE,   object_loc = display_loc,   ...,   fontsize = 10,   geometry = geom_set(),   fig_dim = c(5, 8),   tbl_scale = TRUE,   tbl_stub_pct = 0.3 )

title: Create docorator object — as_docorator
text: x object containing display. See @details information. display_name required name file (excluding extension) display_loc optional path save output file header Document header. Accepts fancyhead object. NULL, header displayed. footer Document footer Accepts fancyfoot object. NULL, footer displayed. save_object Boolean indicating docorator object saved. object_loc path docorator object -  defaults display_loc argument. ... dots future extensions must empty. fontsize Font size (pt). Defaults 10. Accepted values: 10, 11, 12. geometry Document sizing options based geometry latex package. Accepts named list. Default geom_set(). fig_dim vector containing figure height width inches. Defaults c(5,8) tbl_scale Boolean whether automatically scale table columns fit display area. Defaults TRUE. Note overwrite scaling set table directly unless set FALSE. tbl_stub_pct percent total width dedicated stub column(s). 1 stub column total .

title: Create docorator object — as_docorator
text: docorator object

title: Create docorator object — as_docorator
text: x argument flexibly accepts many different R objects, following classes/types recommended: gt gt_group (list gt objects) ggplot list ggplots path PNG file created via png_path() list paths PNG files created via png_path()

title: Create docorator object — as_docorator
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gt::gtcars |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) |>   dplyr::select(mfr, model, year, msrp) |>   gt::gt(groupname_col = "mfr",          row_group_as_column = TRUE) |>   as_docorator(    header = fancyhead(fancyrow("Header 1"), fancyrow("Header 2")),    display_name = "mytbl",    footer = NULL) } # }

what: Decorate and output a table, listing, or figure to a file — docorate
title: Decorate and output a table, listing, or figure to a file — docorate
text: function deprecated replaced as_docorator corresponding render function .e render_pdf

title: Decorate and output a table, listing, or figure to a file — docorate
code: docorate(   x,   filename,   path = NULL,   header = fancyhead(fancyrow(right = doc_pagenum())),   footer = fancyfoot(fancyrow(left = doc_path(filename, path), right = doc_datetime())),   ...,   fontsize = 10,   geometry = geom_set(),   fig_dim = c(5, 8),   tbl_scale = TRUE,   tbl_stub_pct = 0.3 )

title: Decorate and output a table, listing, or figure to a file — docorate
text: x object containing display. See @details information. filename required name file including extension (note: PDF supported currently) path optional path save output pdf header Document header. Accepts fancyhead object. NULL, header displayed. footer Document footer Accepts fancyfoot object. NULL, footer displayed. ... dots future extensions must empty. fontsize Font size (pt). Defaults 10. Accepted values: 10, 11, 12. geometry Document sizing options based geometry latex package. Accepts named list. Default geom_set(). fig_dim vector containing figure height width inches. Defaults c(5,8) tbl_scale Boolean whether automatically scale table columns fit display area. Defaults TRUE. Note overwrite scaling set table directly unless set FALSE. tbl_stub_pct percent total width dedicated stub column(s). 1 stub column total .

title: Construct document footer — fancyfoot
text: Define document footer series fancyrows. row represents new line footer options positioning text left, center, /right positions.

code: fancyfoot(...)

title: Construct document footer — fancyfoot
text: ... Series objects class fancyrow. entry represents new row document footer.

title: Construct document footer — fancyfoot
text: Character string containing latex code fancyfoot entries part fancyhdr latex framework

title: Construct document footer — fancyfoot
code: fancyfoot(  fancyrow(left = "My first footnote", right = doc_datetime()) ) #> [[1]] #> $left #> [1] "My first footnote" #>  #> $center #> [1] NA #>  #> $right #> [1] "30September2025 19:32" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "fancyrow" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "fancyfoot" "fancyhdr"

title: Construct document header row — fancyrow
text: Define single row document header/footer. row represents single line text, options positioning text left, center, /right.

title: Construct document header row — fancyrow
code: fancyrow(left = NA, center = NA, right = NA)

title: Construct document header row — fancyrow
text: left Character string aligned left side row. center Character string aligned center row. right Character string aligned right side row.

title: Construct document header row — fancyrow
text: Object class fancyrow

title: Construct document header row — fancyrow
code: fancyrow(left = "Left most text", right = "Right most text") #> $left #> [1] "Left most text" #>  #> $center #> [1] NA #>  #> $right #> [1] "Right most text" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "fancyrow"  fancyrow(center = "Just text in the center") #> $left #> [1] NA #>  #> $center #> [1] "Just text in the center" #>  #> $right #> [1] NA #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "fancyrow"  fancyrow(left = "All", center = "Three", right = "Positions filled") #> $left #> [1] "All" #>  #> $center #> [1] "Three" #>  #> $right #> [1] "Positions filled" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "fancyrow"

title: Set document geometry defaults — geom_set

title: Set document geometry defaults — geom_set
text: Type geom_set() console view package defaults. Use function add defaults /override included defaults name. values NULL, headheight footskip, values calculated automatically based number header /footer lines. geometry settings, reference documentation : https://texdoc.org/serve/geometry.pdf/0

title: Set document geometry defaults — geom_set
code: # view defaults geom_set() #> $paperheight #> [1] "8.5in" #>  #> $paperwidth #> [1] "11in" #>  #> $left #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $right #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $top #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $bottom #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $headsep #> [1] "10pt" #>  #> $includehead #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $includefoot #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $headheight #> NULL #>  #> $footskip #> NULL #>   # Update the defaults geom_set(left="0.5in", right="0.5in") #> $paperheight #> [1] "8.5in" #>  #> $paperwidth #> [1] "11in" #>  #> $top #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $bottom #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $headsep #> [1] "10pt" #>  #> $includehead #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $includefoot #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $headheight #> NULL #>  #> $footskip #> NULL #>  #> $left #> [1] "0.5in" #>  #> $right #> [1] "0.5in" #>   # add new defaults geom_set(paper = "legalpaper") #> $paperheight #> [1] "8.5in" #>  #> $paperwidth #> [1] "11in" #>  #> $left #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $right #> [1] "1in" #>  #> $top #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $bottom #> [1] "1.25in" #>  #> $headsep #> [1] "10pt" #>  #> $includehead #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $includefoot #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $headheight #> NULL #>  #> $footskip #> NULL #>  #> $paper #> [1] "legalpaper" #>

title: Calculate desired header or footer height for the document — hf_height
code: hf_height(x, fontsize)  # Default S3 method hf_height(x, fontsize)  # S3 method for class 'fancyhdr' hf_height(x, fontsize)

title: Calculate desired header or footer height for the document — hf_height
text: x header footer fontsize Document font size (pt)

title: Calculate desired header or footer height for the document — hf_height
text: Numeric value

title: Calculate desired header or footer height for the document — hf_height
code: header <- fancyhead( fancyrow(left = "Protocol: 12345", right = doc_pagenum()), fancyrow(center = "Demographic Summary"))  hf_height(header, 10) #> [1] 24

title: Process headers/footers — hf_process

title: Process headers/footers — hf_process
code: hf_process(x, escape_latex = TRUE)  # Default S3 method hf_process(x, escape_latex = TRUE)  # S3 method for class 'character' hf_process(x, escape_latex = TRUE)  # S3 method for class 'fancyhead' hf_process(x, escape_latex = TRUE)  # S3 method for class 'fancyfoot' hf_process(x, escape_latex = TRUE)

title: Process headers/footers — hf_process
text: x header footer escape_latex Boolean escape latex header/footer

title: Process headers/footers — hf_process
text: character string containing headers footers latex code

title: Process headers/footers — hf_process
code: header <- fancyhead( fancyrow(left = "Protocol: 12345", right = doc_pagenum()), fancyrow(center = "Demographic Summary"))  hf_process(header) #> [1] "\\fancyhead[L]{\\begin{tabular}[b]{@{}l@{}}Protocol: 12345\\\\\\phantom{}\\end{tabular}}\\fancyhead[C]{\\begin{tabular}[b]{@{}c@{}}\\phantom{}\\\\Demographic Summary\\end{tabular}}\\fancyhead[R]{\\begin{tabular}[b]{@{}r@{}}Page \\thepage\\ of \\pageref*{LastPage}\\\\\\phantom{}\\end{tabular}}"

what: Apply headers and footnotes to gt object — hf_to_gt
title: Apply headers and footnotes to gt object — hf_to_gt

code: hf_to_gt(x)

text: x docorator object

text: gt object (either tbl group)

title: Apply headers and footnotes to gt object — hf_to_gt
code: docorator <- gt::exibble |>   gt::gt()|>   as_docorator(   display_name = "my_tbl",   header = fancyhead(   fancyrow(left = "Protocol: 12345", right = doc_pagenum()),   fancyrow(center = "Demographic Summary")   ),   footer = NULL,   save_object = FALSE)  hf_to_gt(docorator)     Demographic Summary     num       char       fctr       date       time       datetime       currency       row       group     1.111e-01 apricot one 2015-01-15 13:35 2018-01-01 02:22 49.950 row_1 grp_a2.222e+00 banana two 2015-02-15 14:40 2018-02-02 14:33 17.950 row_2 grp_a3.333e+01 coconut three 2015-03-15 15:45 2018-03-03 03:44 1.390 row_3 grp_a4.444e+02 durian four 2015-04-15 16:50 2018-04-04 15:55 65100.000 row_4 grp_a5.550e+03 NA five 2015-05-15 17:55 2018-05-05 04:00 1325.810 row_5 grp_bNA fig six 2015-06-15 NA 2018-06-06 16:11 13.255 row_6 grp_b7.770e+05 grapefruit seven NA 19:10 2018-07-07 05:22 NA row_7 grp_b8.880e+06 honeydew eight 2015-08-15 20:20 NA 0.440 row_8 grp_b

title: Render to pdf — render_pdf
text: Render pdf

title: Render to pdf — render_pdf
code: render_pdf(   x,   display_loc = NULL,   transform = NULL,   header_latex = NULL,   keep_tex = FALSE,   escape_latex = TRUE,   quarto = FALSE )

title: Render to pdf — render_pdf
text: x docorator object display_loc optional path save output pdf transform optional latex transformation function apply gt latex string header_latex optional .tex file header latex keep_tex Boolean indicating keep resulting .tex file latex conversion. Defaults FALSE. escape_latex Boolean indicating headers footers gt table escaped gt::escape_latex quarto Boolean indicating whether use Quarto rendering engine. Defaults FALSE, uses Rmarkdown render.

title: Render to pdf — render_pdf
text: function saves pdf specified location

title: Render to pdf — render_pdf
code: gt::gtcars |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) |>   dplyr::select(mfr, model, year, msrp) |>   gt::gt(groupname_col = "mfr",          row_group_as_column = TRUE) |>   as_docorator(    header = fancyhead(fancyrow("Header 1"), fancyrow("Header 2")),    display_name = "mytbl") |>  render_pdf()

title: Render to rtf — render_rtf
code: render_rtf(   x,   display_loc = NULL,   remove_unicode_ws = TRUE,   use_page_header = FALSE )

title: Render to rtf — render_rtf
text: x docorator object display_loc path save output rtf remove_unicode_ws Option remove unicode white space text. use_page_header TRUE table headings migrated page header. See https://gt.rstudio.com/reference/tab_options.html#arg-page-header-use-tbl-headings

title: Render to rtf — render_rtf
text: function saves rtf specified location

title: Render to rtf — render_rtf
text: Option remove_unicode_ws serves workaround issue gt

title: Render to rtf — render_rtf
code: gt::gtcars |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) |>   dplyr::select(mfr, model, year, msrp) |>   gt::gt(groupname_col = "mfr",          row_group_as_column = TRUE) |>   as_docorator(    header = fancyhead(fancyrow("Header 1"), fancyrow("Header 2")),    display_name = "mytbl") |>  render_rtf()

title: docorator 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-09-30 Improvements * Add qmd PDF engine * Add RTF functionality PNG ggplot2 ready functionality becomes available gt prep_obj_rtf * Rename prep_obj prep_obj_tex change input docorator object * display_name argument as_docorator now required ensure created files explicitly defined Bug fixes * Fix issue fancyrow() reject string vectors length > 1 arguments

title: docorator 0.4.0
text: First open source release
